text: Brian Christopher Deese (born February 17, 1978) is an American economic political advisor. He was the Director of the National Economic Council in the Joe Biden administration from January 20, 2021 until February 21, 2023. Deese was a senior advisor to U.S. President Barack Obama. He was the deputy director of the Office of Management and Budget and was the acting director of the office in the summer of 2014. Deese also was deputy director of the National Economic Council. In December 2020, Deese was chosen as the director of the National Economic Council by Joe Biden. In February 2023, it was announced that Deese would be leaving his position. Vice Chair of the Federal Reserve Lael Brainard was selected as his replacement. ==References== Category:1978 births Category:Living people Category:Politicians from Massachusetts Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Directors of the National Economic Council
